title: Heap overflow in utf32be_mbc_to_code
vulnerability_information:
https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=77418

Buffer overflow in mbc_to_code functions for UTF32BE, UTF32LE, UTF16BE, and UTF16LE due to incorrect length assumptions of a buffer. Provided a patch that was adapted to check the length of the buffer prior to using it.

## Impact

Memory leakage and/or corruption
vulnerability_information_html:
https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=77418

Buffer overflow in mbc_to_code functions for UTF32BE, UTF32LE, UTF16BE, and UTF16LE due to incorrect length assumptions of a buffer. Provided a patch that was adapted to check the length of the buffer prior to using it.

Impact

Memory leakage and/or corruption

activities.message: Affects all currently supported versions of PHP
activities.markdown_message: Affects all currently supported versions of PHP

activities.message:
Just looking for another update on this and my other PHP reports (#476179 and #476178). It's been 8 months since reporting these issues. The issues have long since been resolved in the upstream project, and it is just waiting on the IBB team. I'm a bit disappointed at the lack of updates explaining why there is such a delay. Is there any indication on when this report will be actioned?

I'm happy if it will likely take longer, but an update would be welcomed greatly.
activities.markdown_message:

I'm happy if it will likely take longer, but an update would be welcomed greatly.

activities.message:
Hi,

I'm yet to have an update from the mediation team. I was promised an update 7 days from Sept 12, and I reminded you that I hadn't had an update as of Sept 24. I still have not had an update from your team for this bug, and #476179 and #476178.

These bugs were all resolved upstream 9 months ago, and the last I have heard from the team on any of the tickets was 5 months ago. The mediation staff did not resolve this.

Can I enquire how much longer I need to wait to get an update, and a bounty decision? This delay and lack of response from your team makes me not want to work with Hackerone in the future.

Cheers,

Hugh

activities.message:
Hi,

As I'm yet to have any update from the IBB team, and the mediation team, I've now made the lack of transparency from Hackerone public on twitter. You can see this at https://twitter.com/haquaman/status/1213987366337015809. Note that the details of the report aren't shared (even though the issues have long since been published upstream).

Ideally, Hackerone will investigate why the IBB team are so unresponsive, why the mediation team give unrealistic timeframes, and why the mediation team are also so unresponsive.

This whole process, spanning an entire year, makes me not want to continue using the Hackerone platform, as it is clear that the staff there do not care for the researchers at all.

Really all I have requested is a realistic expectation of a timeframe on when these issues will be resolved. In previous years this process has taken around 6 months, and I never felt like I was out of communication with the team. This time however I feel extremely disconnected with no responses from either IBB or hackerone themselves.

What has changed?

Cheers,

Hugh

activities.message:
Hello @haquaman,

On behalf of the Internet Bug Bounty Panel, thank you for your continued patience on this report. The IBB requires that all in-scope open source projects be mutually engaged with us to ensure there is a good experience for all. Unfortunately, we have not been able to maintain that relationship with the upstream PHP community, and as a result, HackerOne and the IBB Panel have collectively agreed to shut down the program indefinitely.

In an effort to reward researchers for their hard work and patience thus far, the IBB panel has elected to pay bounties to all valid reports without PHP’s input. Bounty amounts are decided on based on the PHP policy and severity assigned on the accompanying CVE. 

As an act of good faith, we will also close this report as Resolved.

Thank you for helping keep the internet safe and secure!
-The Internet Bug Bounty Panel
